title: Classic Mayo-Dressed Tuna Salad Sandwiches
full_text:
Classic Mayo-Dressed Tuna Salad Sandwiches
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Active
25 mins
Infusing Time
15 mins
Total
25 mins
Serves
4
to 8 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1
medium
red onion
(about
8
ounces
;
225
g
), cut into 1/4-inch dice
1/2
cup
(
120
ml
)
red wine vinegar
4
(5-ounce; 140 g) cans
oil-packed tuna
, drained
1
cup
(
240
ml
)
mayonnaise
, plus more as needed
2
stalks
celery
(about
6
ounces
;
170
g
total), cut into 1/4-inch dice
1
ounce
(about
10
stalks
)
flat-leaf parsley leaves
and tender stems, minced (about
1/4
packed
cup
)
1/2
teaspoon
(
3
g
) Asian
fish sauce
or very finely minced oil-packed anchovy fillets (about
2
small
fillets
)
Kosher salt
and freshly
ground black pepper
8
slices
sandwich bread
, very lightly toasted
Romaine lettuce leaves
, torn, for garnish
Directions
In a small bowl, combine onion and vinegar (vinegar should just cover onion; add more if it does not) and let stand 15 minutes.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine tuna and mayonnaise and mix very well with a spoon until tuna is reduced to very small shreds.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Drain onion well, then add to tuna along with celery, parsley, and fish sauce or anchovy. Mix until well incorporated, then season with salt and pepper. Add more mayo, 1 tablespoon at a time, if desired.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Spoon tuna salad onto 4 bread slices, top with lettuce leaves, then close sandwiches. Serve right away.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
